description: First attested in 1300 as Middle English saveour, from Old French sauveour, from Late Latin salvātor, from salvo. Displaced native Old English hǣlend.

entries.meaning: A person who saves someone, rescues another from harm.
(medicine) A child who is born to provide an organ or cell transplant to a sibling who has an otherwise fatal disease (used in combination, with "sibling", "baby", "child", "brother", "sister", etc.)
